= We archive wikis, from Wikipedia to tiniest wikis =

*!WikiTeam software is a set of tools for archiving wikis.* They work on !MediaWiki wikis, but we want to expand to other wiki engines. As of February 2014, !WikiTeam has preserved more than [AvailableBackups 10,000 stand-alone] wikis, several [WikiFarms wikifarms], regular Wikipedia dumps and [https://archive.org/details/wikimediacommons 24TB of Wikimedia Commons images].

There are [http://wikiindex.org thousands] [http://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Sites_using_MediaWiki/en of] [http://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Sites_using_MediaWiki/multilingual wikis] in the Internet. Everyday some of them are no longer publicly available and, due to lack of [AvailableBackups backups], lost forever. Millions of people download tons of media files (movies, music, books, etc) from the Internet, implementing a kind of distributed backup. Wikis, most of them under free licenses, disappear from time to time because nobody grabbed a copy of them. That is a shame that we would like to solve.

*!WikiTeam* is the [http://www.archiveteam.org Archive Team] subcommittee on wikis. It was founded and originally developed by [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/User:Emijrp Emilio J. Rodríguez-Posada], a Wikipedia veteran editor and amateur archivist. Many people have help sending suggestions, [http://code.google.com/p/wikiteam/issues/list reporting bugs], writing [http://code.google.com/p/wikiteam/w/list documentation], providing help in the [http://groups.google.com/group/wikiteam-discuss mailing list] and making [AvailableBackups wiki backups]. Thanks to all, especially to: [http://meta.wikimedia.org/wiki/User:Nemo_bis Federico Leva], Alex Buie, [http://www.sdboyd56.com Scott Boyd], [http://meta.wikimedia.org/wiki/User:Hydriz Hydriz], Platonides, Ian !McEwen and Mike Dupont.

= Current events =
The last *news* (follow us on [http://twitter.com/#!/WikiTeamProject Twitter] too!):
  * 2014-02-14: Today, [https://archive.org/details/wikiteam WikiTeam collection] at Internet Archive has surpassed the 10,000 wikis milestone. We love wikis. Happy Valentine's Day!
  * 2013-10-14: WikiTeam has just finished archiving all [http://commons.wikimedia.org Wikimedia Commons] files up to 2012 on the [https://archive.org/details/wikimediacommons Internet Archive]. About 24 TB of content.
  * 2013-03-17: Niklas Laxström has kindly provided a [https://archive.org/details/wiki-translatewikinet_w dump of translatewiki.net] (13th biggest wiki by number of pages).
  * 2013-01-27: [https://archive.org/details/wikia_dump_20121204 Wikia wikis dumps archived]. About 34,000 wikis have dumps, one tenth of existing Wikia wikis. Wikia has now restricted dump requests to "autoconfirmed" users.

Read [News older news]. For a more detailed action log, see http://code.google.com/p/wikiteam/updates/list.

= What can you do? =
You can do *a lot of* things:
  * Read our [FAQ]
  * Download our [http://code.google.com/p/wikiteam/source/checkout scripts and software], read our [NewTutorial Tutorial] and backup your favorite wiki. Send us a copy of the backup if you want!
  * Download some [http://code.google.com/p/wikiteam/downloads/list?can=1 backups] of wikis. Additionally, there are more backups at [http://www.archive.org/search.php?query=subject%3A%22wikiteam%22 Internet Archive].
  * [http://code.google.com/p/wikiteam/issues/list Report a bug or request a feature]
  * Use the backups to [Research research] how wiki communities evolve
  * Subscribe to the mailing lists: [http://groups.google.com/group/wikiteam-discuss general discussion] and [http://groups.google.com/group/wikiteam-developers developer discussion]
  * Follow us on Twitter! [http://twitter.com/#!/wikiteamproject @WikiTeamProject]

= Research =
Are you a *researcher*? If you have conducted any [Research research] about wikis using our software or the backups we made available, we would be glad to hear from your experience. [Research Contact us].

This project contains a lot of material. *Be careful with the licenses*.
  * The [http://code.google.com/p/wikiteam/source/checkout source code] is [http://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl-3.0.html GPLv3]
  * The [http://code.google.com/p/wikiteam/w/list documentation] in this site is [http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0/ Creative Commons 3.0 BY-SA]
  * Every [AvailableBackups backup] of every wiki has its own license. Visit the wiki and search for the license of texts and images. Read more in our [FAQ]

= Note =
Due to lack of space, we do not offer image dumps in Google Code. *The dumps only include the texts of the wikis (usually full histories).* Although you can run the script and generate your own backup which would contain all the texts and images (if you use _--xml_ _--images_ options).

= Contact =
If you want to *contact with the !WikiTeam community*, you can do it:
  * For bug reports, new features requests, notices about new wikis to backup: http://code.google.com/p/wikiteam/issues/list
  * General discussion about !WikiTeam tools and help for new users: http://groups.google.com/group/wikiteam-discuss
  * Developers discussion about bugs, patches, features: http://groups.google.com/group/wikiteam-developers
  * There is a social IRC channel in Efnet: irc://efnet/wikiteam ([http://chat.efnet.org:9090/?nick=&channels=%23wikiteam&Login=Login webchat access])

Also, [http://code.google.com/p/wikiteam/w/list every wiki page] allows to send comments.

If you want to contact using e-mail, you can send your messages regarding !WikiTeam to [mailto:emijrp@gmail.com emijrp@gmail.com].
